title: How to know that a particular music or song is copyright protected - Quora

response.answer_text: Under the international Berne Convention, all musical works are granted copyright protection as soon as they are fixed in a tangible medium. In other words, once a composer puts to paper or records a musical work, it is automatically protected by copyright for a period of time. In the United States, all works published before 1923 are in the public domain; that is, their copyright protection period has expired. Works published after 1922, but before 1978 are protected for 95 years from the date of publication. If the work was created, but not published, before 1978, the copyright lasts for the life of the author plus 70 years.

Every creations in this planet are copyright protected to the First Author of the Creation. The aim is not knowing if it is protected or not but identifying the Author of the creation in case of Music that should be the Singer along with his entire team. when you find out that then see if the lifeline of the musician from the date of the creation had been passed over 100 years or not ? if its already past 100 years after the death of the song creator then you should know that this particular song belongs to the public domain and you are entitled to use the same in any form.
